page.title: 07WEMBURY BEACH 2
page.content: (continued) and converted fifty years ago to seat about 40 for refreshments. The path turns left steeply past toilets,over paths to the{National {Trust shop}and cliff top car park to ascend by{St. Werburgh's Church,}or turns right to the beach. Concrete steps lead down from the shop over the remains of a{World War II pill box. Another concrete slab across the beach lying under the{6.5m red soil cliffs marks the other{gunnery point.}Rock pools are rich with{seaweed}and{fauna. {Acorn barnacles,limpets,topshells,per- {iwinkles,shrimps,prawns,crabs}and {beadlet anemones,} are common. Less abundant are{crinoids,snakelocks {anemones, brittlestars, cushion stars, {breadcrumb sponges}and{mussels.}No {whelks}or{cowrie shells}were seen but {tubeworm}and{lugworm casts}were seen at{low tide water level.
